here is my problem, the ADC is so strong atm.  So its if you can't zerg the adc down then they will kill you in the fight.  Even at lower levels I fill like the power of ADC's is really strong.  Maybe its just AD in general is strong.  But now you have Janna that shield and give ad.  But then you can't jump on the adc because of her ult.  So in the game where ADC burst is way too high it makes sense she is op.  Because the adc will 3 shot you and her shields are huge.  Then 2 cc's behind it.  Then the AD from the shield is really a lot.  Its like a free BF sword at max levels.  that is crazy.

atm shield ratio needs to be 45% instead of 70% and the ad needs to be cut in Half cd moved to 15 secs instead of 10.

Shield in general needs to be cut in half to 2/3 and increase the duration by 50% to 25%.  Heals need to do 75% now and 25% as a hot.

Right not with 45% cd.  She only had .5 sec where the shield will not be on.  Then you look at how much is shields for and its crazy.  She needs tuned down and ADC need tuned down a little aswell.  Its a two part problem.  Notice the same Support are op once it because a ADC Raid boss meta.
i think the ad should be taken off and maybe add that litle power somewhere else on her.i never knew that it even gave ad till i read a post yesterday
If you remove the AD then you've just got a shield with no unique aspect whatsoever.
and thats a problem, why?
Because it removes part of Janna's identity, her kit is just fine.

i really dont think that janna is defined by extra ad on a shield lol. tbh it doesnt make a whole lot of sense and with ads being strong as fuck rn removing it would be a good nerf.. then like i said just add tht power somewehere else. janna is defined by her amazing peel, not some ad buff.
you don't need to remove her shield's AD to nerf Janna and ADCs.
i nevr said it had to happen.it was just my suggestion

On my opinion, balance >>> identity

if the identity of a champion is something that is broken, then this means this champion needs another identity.
But there's nothing 'broken' about Janna's kit. The items she uses may be overtuned right now, but that doesn't mean you need to remove something in her kit.

We had some nerfs planned for Janna and Taric, but opted to wait to see how the Ardent changes pan out first so we know how far we need to go. We didn't want to double hit them in one patch both with direct kit nerfs and item nerfs, but we have a task on our board to make sure to monitor both of them in the next few days now that 7.17 is out to see if we need to do any/to what degree we need to followup on both of them.

Reducing both the attack speed  buff and on-hit health drain at level 18 by ~30% is "hardly a nerf"? By the time you actually complete the item, it's still about a 10% nerf to those. 

I know Ardent is strong right now, but, come on Rubick. No need to dumpster the item.

-the 10% bonus as is nothing because it's in late game, and marksmen have a lot of as here

But the point of not nerfing janna and taric was to wait and see so that they know exactly how much to nerf them by. I mean if they nerfed them to much it would be hard to tell how much of a buff the champs would need to not be terrible since no one would play them if they went to far.

point is it's broken af will be rushed on all enchenters, enchenters will continue to rule the game, and support trundle will still be forced to take stoneborn and ardent to compete

other point is, coin will still be broken and built on 100% of the supports

if they nerfed with good nerfs those 2 items, janna would be fixed because she can't use any other sup item than coin, and she's the best user of ardent due to no mana problem shield
The item lost ALL scaling... late game it is probably better to sell it and get something more suitable to late game teamfighting.

Remove 10% AS from Static Shiv and no ADC will buy it. Remove 10 AD from Infinity Edge, and its purchase rate will plummet. Remove 2% lifesteal or on-hit damage from BorK, and people will forget it exists, again. It isn't quite as bad for Ardent, since it doesn't give those stats permanently, but you get the idea.

Supports will definitely still buy it, probably as much as they have been. But that's because supports won't feel the change themselves. Those stats effectively don't belong to them - those are their allies' stats.

People will still be rushing Ardent this patch, highly likely that nerf did much.

People will still rush it, but it won't be as oppressive. Just because they are building it doesn't mean it's OP. In fact, I'd be surprised to see it was still a good rush on Taric given that he scales with health and armor, as well. If Ardent is in a good spot, it's probably more situational for him.
